page.title: 16THE HOLLOW, SHREWTON
page.content: The burial ground known as The Hollow, is a steep narrow hill leading onto a Bridleway known locally as The Cleave, which has lovely views of Shrewton and Orcheston and comes out at the Gibbett - a well known landmark from the past. Properties have been built on both sides of the Hollow, and they range from very old thatched cottages, to modern bungalows. The high walled entrances to many of the properties were once used to house air raid shelters during the second world war. The left hand side is within the Parish of Shrewton whilst the right hand side belongs to Orcheston, and is consequently rated lower than Shrewton Recently the remains of a{Beakerman} was dug up in one of the gardens, and it can now be seen in the Salisbury Museum.
